title: Null Hypothesis Definition
text: H_0 — the null hypothesis: a statement of no difference between sample means or proportions or no difference between a sample mean or proportion and a population mean or proportion.

title: Finding H_0
text: Oftentimes, when the question talks about an assumption or belief about a parameter, it is a hint that the parameter value will be used as the null hypothesis. In this question, we can find the answer here: "It is believed that the mean height of high school students who play basketball on the school team is 73 inches with a standard deviation of 1.8 inches."
